titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Snider Family Papers, 1912-1938 (bulk 1914-1918)
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by the Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jessica Kemm November 2009

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Correspondence from Mary and Marguerite Snider to their parents and brother Frank tell of the day-to-day life of Vassar students, their classes, extra-curricular activities, and social life. Letters to and from Frank tell a similar story of his days at Mercersburg Academy in Pennsylvania, and Amherst College in Massachusetts.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Twins Mary and Marguerite Snyder graduated from Vassar in 1918. Born December 20, 1895 in Uniontown, Pennsylvania to Frank and Hannah (Happie) L. Snider, they returned to Uniontown after their graduation. Both Mary and Marguerite worked with the Red Cross during World War and after, Marguerite until 1925 and Mary until at least 1947. Marguerite earned a certificate in economic research and community organization at Bryn Mawr in 1921 and her C.L.U. from the College of Life Underwriters. She worked as an underwriter for the Equitable Life Assurance Society beginning in 1925. She married attorney Buell B. Whitehill in 1945. She died in October 1980. Mary did not marry and lived at the family home on Kensington Avenue in Uniontown until at least 1960. Alumnae surveys in 1947 and 1956 indicate that she was the Home Service Secretary of the American Red Cross’s Fayette County chapter. In 1960, she reported that she was the part-time Executive Secretary of the Mental Health Association of Fayette County. She retired in 1971. Mary Snider died in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from Mary and Marguerite Snider to their parents and brother Frank tell of the day-to-day life of Vassar students, their classes, extra-curricular activities, and social life. Letters to and from Frank tell a similar story of his days at Mercersburg Academy [Pennsylvania] and Amherst College.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Original encoding by Jessica Kemm, November, 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Dates added in brackets are from postmarks on original envelopes. Those envelopes have been discarded.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mary and Jacob Leed, August 2009 (M2009-026). An additional accession, folders 2.10-2.11, were given in April 2010 (M2010-009).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Snider Family Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

scopecontent.p: Series I includes letters to and from Marguerite Snider, as well as official Vassar College documents and correspondence.
Series II includes letters to and from Mary Snider, as well as official Vassar College documents and correspondence.
Series IV includes letters to and from Frank Snider, as well as correspondence related to his academic record and documents regarding his military training.
Series V includes letters to and from brother Joe Snider and to mother Hannah (Happie) Snider as well as other miscellaneous correspondence.
